title: Proxy annex configs from .datalad/config to annex "runtime"
body:
git (annex) does not pick up `.datalad/config` as a configuration file to be considered for its operations.  But such options as `annex.security.allowed-*-addresses` might need to be "committed" into the dataset's config to enable access to some addresses.  See e.g.  [redirection to ftp](http://git-annex.branchable.com/bugs/regression__58___http_downloads_redirecting_to_ftp_are_no_longer_supported/#comment-82edbccee752ca3876437d7c034e6461) issue which was brought up by #3321 .

The easiest solution would be to instruct git (annex) to **also** consider  .datalad/config, but AFAIK it is not possible. `man git-config` says that `GIT_CONFIG` environment variable overrides the default `.git/config` (or `~/.gitconfig` in case of `--global`).  

So another solution would be to load dataset specific config and for each invocation of git (annex) pass explicitly the options which are not otherwise defined in the config.

May be there is a better solution?
